intro: Palicourea tepuiensis, commonly known as the tepui piper, is a climbing shrub native to the tepuis of southern Venezuela and northern Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many tropical flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments at high elevations. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
